intro: Sorghum alopecurus, commonly known as mouse barley, is a flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and is often found in moist, grassy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. It is an annual plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. Sorghum alopecurus is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
